content:
Thunderbird è un programma gratuito, non ci sono operatori perché non ci sono risorse per pagarli. Se hai bisogni di questo genere di aiuto ti conviene contattare un tecnico dalle tue parti.

Il trasferimento dei dati comunque è molto semplice, lo trovi spiegato qui -> https://support.mozilla.org/it/kb/trasferire-dati-thunderbird-nuovo-computer (c'è anche un video che lo illustra passo-a-passo)
creator: @next

content: "Delete" is a powerful verb. You can check your account online and see if Gmail retained any of it in trash. Thunderbird does not do backups.
creator: davidsk

content: What version are you using? Did the problem start exactly when you updated to that version? Do you have Thunderbird files or Thunderbird profile on a network drive?
creator: wsmwk

content: It may help to post screenshot of your incoming server settings pane to get possible feedback. deleting the profile is not necessary as that contains your addressbook and other settings. However, to locate your profile, click help>troubleshootinginformation, scroll down to 'profile folder' and click 'open folder'. I share that for your information, not as a suggestion to delete it.
creator: davidsk

content:
Thanks David. Screenshot attached of settings.

For profile, the open folder prompt doesn't work. It gives an error. Also attached.

Dan
creator: dan307

content:
Try this:: - change to table view if not already there. This is the view that shows columns, such as subject, from, date - click the icon on right of the top line in message list pane to add 'tags' column in the display - tag the desired message - click view>sort by and set to tags - now, click the tags column entry on bar at top of message list pane and the tagged item will appear at top.

My suggestion was to use tags, but you can view the menu at view>sort by and you may prefer another option, such as star or priority.
creator: davidsk

content:
Potrebbe trattarsi del problema discusso qui: https://forum.mozillaitalia.org/index.php?topic=79602.0 Però non so se sia il tuo caso, Per poter inquadrare il problema prova a fornire queste informazioni:

  1. Versione di Thunderbird
  2. Versione del sistema operativo
  3. Provider delle caselle email (Gmail, Libero, Hotmail, etc.)
  4. Tipologia di account (POP3, IMAP)
  5. Estensioni installate
  6. Messaggi di errore che vengono visualizzati durante l'utilizzo di Thunderbird
  7. Software di sicurezza eventualmente presenti (Antivirus e simili)
  8. Screenshot del problema (se utile a chiarire il contesto)
creator: @next

content: By the way, both the stable and beta releases have the same problem. That is unrelated.

First, reinstalling thunderbird accomplishes nothing, as thunderbird is not the issue. Try this: - click account settings>synchronizaion&storage for each account and set sync to just recent 30 days. - next, exit thunderbird - in profile, in the imap\<accountname> folder for each account, DELETE the message folders and their msf entries. - restart thunderbird, which will repopulate the folders with the new sync setting - then, periodically compact the folders. That is what is causing space on PC to be bigger than space on server.

The phone is a separate entity and has the same issues, but is not a cause of the space usage.
creator: davidsk

content:
I profili non sono nella cartella di Thunderbird, ma in una cartella del profilo utente. Qui è spiegato come individuarla -> https://support.mozilla.org/it/kb/profili-thunderbird#w_come-trovare-il-proprio-profilo

Se riesci a recuperare questa cartella, ripristinarla è semplice basta sovrascriverla a quella del profilo di default creato da Thunderbird al primo avvio -> https://forum.mozillaitalia.org/index.php?topic=16165.0

Senza quella cartella non si può fare nulla.
creator: @next

content: Che io sappia no. Scarica messaggi funziona su tutti gli account configurati. Ma se l'account non ti serve più, non puoi semplicemente trasferirne le cartelle sotto Cartelle locali?
creator: @next

Per l'estensione non si può fare nulla se non sperare che lo sviluppatore la aggiorni.

content: Voor de Nederlandstaligen: Ik heb op mijn laptop een nieuwe agenda aangemaakt in Thunderbird (netwerk) en deze gekoppeld aan de CalDAV-url van mijn NAS. Nu worden alleen de afspraken die ik in Thunderbird maak direct gesynchroniseerd met de NAS, maar Thunderbird download de items die al op de NAS staan ​​niet. Mijn andere pc met Outlook en mijn telefoon synchroniseren beide perfect in twee richtingen met de NAS. Welke instelling kan ik in Thunderbird wijzigen om de items die op de NAS staan ​​te downloaden?
creator: josvdh

content: Please send suggestions to connect.mozilla.org and sign to the IDEAS section. Thank you for your interest .
creator: davidsk
